summary: How does the IRS ensure that your taxes are accurate? The IRS gets information from employers, banks, and other third-parties about your income and other factors that can affect your tax bill. Mismatches between this information and what you report on your taxes can indicate errors or potential fraud. The IRS processes billions of third-party information returns. But the system isn't managed strategically—returns come on...
title: Tax Administration: Better Coordination Could Improve IRS's Use of Third-Party Information Reporting to Help Reduce the Tax Gap
